questions.questionText: Which of the following does TypeScript use to specify types?
questions.explanation: TS uses a colon (:) to separate the property name from the property type.

questions.questionText: What does the acronym 'HTML' stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, used for structuring content on the web.
CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used for styling web pages.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a JavaScript framework?
questions.explanation: Django is a Python web framework, not a JavaScript framework.
